pronunciation: DECE'ASE, [Latin to depart or to withdraw.]

definitions.text:
Decease
 [Latin to depart or to withdraw.] Literally, departure; hence, departure from this life; death; applied to human beings only.Moses and Elias, who appeared in glory, and spoke of his decease which he should accomplish at Jerusalem. Luke 9:31.DECE'ASE,
To depart from this life; to die.Gen. Washington deceased, December 14, 1799, in the 68th year of his age.
